summary: An Ordinance providing for the improvement of North Seventy-sixth Street and West Seventy-sixth Street, in the City of Seattle, from Greenwood Avenue to Eighth Avenue Northwest, by constructing water mains therein of proper dimensions and materials, together with all gates, tees, crosses and other appurtenances necessary for the reasonable water service and fire protection of said district, in accordance with Resolution No. 616 of the City Council of the City of Seattle, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by the laws of the State of Washington and the Charter and Ordinances of the City of Seattle
